intro: Mammea woodii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mammea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in panicles. Mammea woodii is also notable for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional Hawaiian medicine.
